quote.saying: Narakloka is a place of suffering and pain. It is the destination of those who have committed evil deeds.
Narakloka is like a prison. It is a place where the soul is trapped in suffering.
Kulkhyaya is the detachment from the fruits of action. It is the state of mind that is free from attachment and desire.
Kulkhyaya is like a flame. It burns away all impurities and attachments.

quote.name: As a person puts on new garments, giving up old ones, the soul similarly accepts new material bodies, giving up the old and useless ones.” (Chapter 2, Verse 22 of the Bhagavad Gita)
Punarjanma is like a river. It flows endlessly and always finds its way to its destination.(Bhagavad Gita)

toast: You have landed in māyā as a result of ahaṅkāra
toastTitle: It was a Snake from 55 to 2

quote.name: Kumbhīpaka is a terrible hell where the sinners are roasted in a copper pot filled with oil. The heat of the oil is so intense that the sinners' flesh melts and drips down like molten wax.( Mahabharata)
Agastya was a Kumbhīpaka, born from a jar.( Mahābhārata)

toast: You have landed in krodha as a result of durbuddhi
toastTitle: It was a Snake from 61 to 3

quote.name: Mahaduhkha is the greatest suffering, which is caused by attachment to the material world.”(Bhagavat Gita)
Mahaduhkha is like a fire. It burns away all impurities and attachments.( Bhagavad Gita)

toast: You have landed in lobha as a result of dveṣa
toastTitle: It was a Snake from 16 to 4

quote.name: The fruits of our past actions, purvasukrita, follow us like the shadow of our body.(Bhagavad Gita (Chapter 6, Verse 45)
Purvasukrita is like a seed. It bears fruit in this life.(Mahabharata)
Susanskara is the cultivation of good qualities, such as purity, compassion, and non-violence.( Bhagavad Gita)
The wise man who cultivates good qualities attains lasting peace.( Bhagavad Gita)

toast: You have landed in moha as a result of adharma
toastTitle: It was a Snake from 29 to 6

quote.name: Madhurabhashana is sweet speech, which is spoken with love and compassion.(Bhagavad Gita)
The wise man who speaks sweetly, who is always kind and compassionate, is loved by all.(Bhagavad Gita)

toast: You have landed in abhimāna as a result of kusangati
toastTitle: It was a Snake from 24 to 7

quote.name: Vaibhavanasha is the destruction of the ego, which is the root of all suffering.(Bhagavad Gita)
The wise man who is free from ego, who is always humble and content, attains lasting peace.(Bhagavad Gita)

toast: You have landed in mithyā as a result of ịrṣyā
toastTitle: It was a Snake from 12 to 8

quote.name: Pranasankata is the fear of death, which is the root of all anxiety.Bhagavad Gita (Chapter 18, Verse 61)
The wise man who is free from fear of death, who is always calm and collected, is said to have attained perfection.(Bhagavad Gita)

toast: You have landed in kāma as a result of avidyā
toastTitle: It was a Snake from 44 to 9

quote.name: Tamoloka is the realm of darkness, where the souls of those who have lived a life of sin are reborn.(Bhagavad Gita)(Chapter 14, Verse 19)
Those who are envious, cruel, and arrogant, who are always impure, and who hate the Vedas, go to Tamoloka.(Bhagavad Gita)
Napunsakatva is the state of being neither male nor female, which is considered to be a curse.(Mahabharata)
The only way to escape the curse of napunsakatva is to live a life of virtue and purity.(Mahabharata)
Bhirutva is the quality of fear, which is the enemy of wisdom.Bhagavad Gita (Chapter 18, Verse 60)
The wise man who is free from fear, who is always calm and collected, is said to have attained perfection.(Bhagavad Gita)
Lokaranjan is the desire to please others, which is a distraction from the path of spiritual enlightenment.(Bhagavad Gita)
The wise man who is free from the desire to please others, who is always content with himself, attains lasting peace.(Bhagavad Gita)

toast: You have landed in antarikṣa as a result of tāmasloka
toastTitle: It was a Snake from 63 to 13

quote.name: Dharmnishtha is the unshakable commitment to dharma, which is the path of righteousness.(Bhagavad Gita)
The wise man who is committed to dharma, who is always doing his duty, attains perfection.(Bhagavad Gita)
Brahmacharyashrama is the vow of celibacy, which is essential for spiritual growth.(Chapter 18, Verse 64.)
Through celibacy, one attains the highest goal. Upanishads (Katha Upanishad, Verse 1.3.10)
Sahasa is the quality of courage, which is essential for spiritual growth.the Bhagavad Gita (Chapter 18, Verse 62)
Courage is not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.(Mahabharata)
Sushilata is the embodiment of patience and perseverance. She is a reminder that we can achieve anything we set our minds to, if we are willing to work hard and never give up.(Mahabharata)
Sushilata is a shining example of how women can be strong and independent. She is a reminder that women are just as capable as men, and that they can achieve great things.(Mahabharata)
Ghor papa pravritti is the path of extreme evil, which leads to destruction.Bhagavad Gita
The path of extreme evil is a dark and dangerous path. It leads to suffering and destruction. We should avoid this path at all costs.(Mahabharata)
Swasthyanash is the destruction of one's own well-being. It is caused by greed, anger, and attachment.(Mahabharata)

The root cause of all suffering is attachment. When we are attached to things, we become possessive and fearful. We are afraid of losing what we have, and this fear leads to anger and violence.(Bhagavad Gita)
Murchchha is the loss of consciousness, which is caused by fear.(Bhagavad Gita)
Fear is a natural emotion, but it should not control our lives. We should learn to face our fears and to overcome them.(Mahabharata)
Satsang is association with the wise, which is like a river of nectar. It washes away the sins of the past and leads to enlightenment.(Shvetashvatara Upanishad)
The wise man who associates with the wise, who listens to their words and follows their advice, attains perfection.(Bhagavad Gita on satsang)
Matsarya is the feeling of jealousy, which is a hindrance to spiritual growth.(Bhagavad Gita)
Jealousy is a poison that can destroy our happiness. It is important to let go of jealousy and to focus on our own blessings.(Mahabharata on matsarya)
Sadviveka is the discrimination between the real and the unreal, which is essential for spiritual growth.(Bhagavad Gita)
The wise man who is able to discriminate between the real and the unreal, who is able to see beyond the illusion of the world, attains enlightenment.(Upanishads on sadviveka)

toast: You have landed in swargaloka as a result of tapa
toastTitle: Got Ladder from 10 to 23

quote.name: Vidyadhyana is the pursuit of knowledge, which is essential for spiritual growth.(Bhagavad Gita)
The wise man who pursues knowledge, who is always learning and growing, attains enlightenment.(Upanishads on vidyadhyana)
Jnanechchha is the desire for knowledge, which is essential for spiritual growth.(Bhagavad Gita)
The wise man who has a thirst for knowledge, who is always seeking to learn new things, attains enlightenment.(Upanishads on jnanechchha)
Atmaghata is the act of self-harm, which is a sin.(Mahabharata)
The wise man who knows the value of life will never harm himself. He will always strive to live a life of peace and harmony.(Mahabharata on atmaghata)
Sadupdesha is the best gift that one can give to another. It is the gift of knowledge and wisdom.(the first chapter of the Hitopadesa)
Sadupdesha is like a lamp. It illuminates the darkness of ignorance.(Hitopadesa)
Ninda is the act of criticizing others, which is a hindrance to spiritual growth.(Bhagavad Gita)
The tongue is a sharp weapon, and it can cut deeper than any sword. Be careful not to use it to wound others, for the wound of the tongue takes a long time to heal.(Mahabharata)
Viryanash is the wasting of energy, which is a hindrance to spiritual growth.(Bhagavad Gita)
The wise man knows how to conserve his energy. He does not waste his time and energy on futile pursuits.(Mahabharata on viryanash)
Dushkarma is the doing of evil, which is a hindrance to spiritual growth
The wise man knows that the fruits of his actions follow him like a shadow. He therefore avoids doing evil, for he knows that it will only lead to suffering.
Sampatti is not just material possessions. It is also the wealth of knowledge, wisdom, and compassion.
Sampatti is like a tree. It provides shelter and sustenance for many.
Bhrunhatya is the act of killing a pregnant woman, which is a sin of the highest order. The person who commits this sin will suffer in hell for many lifetimes.
The person who commits bhrunhatya will suffer in hell for many lifetimes. He will be reborn as an animal or a lower being. He will never be able to achieve liberation.

toast: You have landed in mahaloka as a result of dāna
toastTitle: Got Ladder from 20 to 32

quote.name: Let the (twice-born) man, after his studentship is finished, take a wife and dwell in (his own) house during the second period of his life; he must live without giving pain (to others), and practice the duty which is fit for him (i.e., which belongs to his order).
Householders incur no sin when they enjoy their legitimate pleasures, consistent with the sacred law, by all their senses, and chiefly by the mind.
The world is like a dream, a mirage, or a bubble. It is not real. It is an illusion.
False luxury is the cause of all destruction.
Jaya is victory, which is the goal of all human endeavor. It is achieved through hard work, dedication, and perseverance.
Victory and defeat are equal to us. We should not worry about the fruits of our actions. Our duty is to act, and to act without attachment to the results

toast: You have landed in naraka as a result of himsā
toastTitle: It was a Snake from 52 to 35

quote.name: Pramada is heedlessness, which is the cause of all suffering. It is the root of all evil.
The heedless man is like a boat without a rudder, tossed about by the waves of samsara (rebirth).
Atirati is the act of going to extremes, which is a hindrance to spiritual growth.
The wise man avoids extremes, for he knows that they lead to suffering. He finds the middle path, which is the path to happiness and enlightenment.
Dvesha is the feeling of hatred or aversion, which is a hindrance to spiritual growth.
The wise man avoids hatred, for he knows that it leads to suffering. He cultivates love and compassion for all beings.
Satkarmarati is the love of good action, which is essential for spiritual growth.
The man who loves good action is like a river that flows in a straight course. He is not diverted by obstacles, and he eventually reaches his destination.
Shoka is the feeling of grief or sorrow, which is a hindrance to spiritual growth.
The wise man does not grieve, for he knows that all things are impermanent. He accepts the reality of loss and disappointment, and he does not allow them to cloud his judgment.
Samyama is the one-pointed concentration of the mind on an object, without any distractions.
Samyama is the culmination of the practice of yoga. It leads to the realization of the Self.

toast: You have landed in janaloka as a result of paramārtha
toastTitle: Got Ladder from 27 to 41

quote.name: “Atithi devo bhava: A guest is like a god”
A guest is the Supreme Lord.
“One who goes to a place with faith, reaches that place with faith. One cannot reach any other place”
“Wealth cannot be obtained through injustice”(Mahabharata)
“The result of injustice is suffering, fear, and failure” (Mahabharata)
“Acharya seva is the highest form of service. It is a way of showing our gratitude to our guru for their teachings and guidance”
This verse highlights that the guru is equivalent to the Holy Trinity (Brahma, Vishnu, and Maheshwara) and is the embodiment of the Supreme Brahman.
“Buddhinashanashatisarvam: The destruction of knowledge destroys everything”(Manu Smriti).
Anger leads to clouding of judgment, which results in bewilderment of memory. When the memory is bewildered, the intellect gets destroyed; and when the intellect is destroyed, one is ruined.
“Vyavhichara-suddha-dhih: A clear mind is the result of critical thinking”(Yoga Sutras of Patanjali)
“Vyavhicharenasarva-jnanamlabhatam”: All knowledge is attained through critical thinking(the Nyaya Sutras of Gotama)
“Durvyasana-sthiti-klesodhyanasyaviparyayaha”: The difficulty of sitting in a difficult seat is the obstacle to meditation.(Yoga Sutras of Patanjali)

The five great sacrifices are: 1) dharmayajna, the sacrifice of religious duty; 2) arthyayajna, the sacrifice of material prosperity; 3) kamayajna, the sacrifice of desire; 4) mokshayajna, the sacrifice of liberation; and 5) satyayajna, the sacrifice of truth.
Viveka is the ability to distinguish between the real and the unreal, the eternal and the transient, the good and the evil.
Viveka is the foundation of all spiritual practice.
The vanprastha ashrama is a time to simplify one's life and to focus on the essentials.
The vanprastha ashrama is a time to let go of attachments and to find inner peace.

toast: You have landed in tapaloka as a result of sudharma
toastTitle: Got Ladder from 28 to 50

quote.name: Prema is the highest form of love. It is selfless, unconditional, and all-encompassing.
Prema is the essence of all religions.

toast: You have landed in prithvi as a result of tamoguna
toastTitle: It was a Snake from 72 to 51

quote.name: Vinayabhava is the attitude of humility and respect. It is the opposite of arrogance and pride.
Vinayabhava is the foundation of all virtue.
Andhakaar is the absence of light. It is the ignorance that blinds us from the truth. It is the fear that holds us back from our full potential.
Andhakaar is the enemy of truth. It is the illusion that keeps us from seeing the world as it really is. It is the attachment that prevents us from letting go.
Vishvasghata is the greatest sin, for it destroys trust and relationships. It is a poison that can seep into the soul and corrupt it. One who commits vishvasghata will never find peace or happiness.
Vishvasghata is the most heinous of all sins. It is worse than murder, for it destroys the soul. One who commits vishvasghata will be punished in the afterlife.
Bhayasthana is the place of fear. It is the place where we feel most vulnerable and insecure. It is the place where we are most likely to give in to our fears.
Bhayasthana is the place where we can find our true strength. It is the place where we can overcome our fears and become free.
Sadachaara is the foundation of all virtue. It is the practice of good conduct in thought, word, and deed.
Sadachaara is the path to moksha. It is the way to liberation from the cycle of birth and death.
Trishna is the root of all suffering. It is the desire for things that are not ours, or that we cannot have. It is the attachment to things that are impermanent.
Trishna is the enemy of happiness. It is the desire for things that will never satisfy us. It is the attachment to things that will always change.
Paropakara is the highest form of dharma. It is the act of helping others without any expectation of reward.
Paropakara is the path to moksha. It is the way to liberation from the cycle of birth and death.
Indriyanigraha is the mastery of the senses. It is the ability to control our thoughts, feelings, and actions.
Indriyanigraha is the path to liberation. It is the way to overcome the limitations of the material world.
Vidyaprapti is the goal of human life. It is the pursuit of knowledge and wisdom.
Vidyaprapti is the path to enlightenment. It is the way to achieve union with the divine.

toast: You have landed in Subuddhi as a result of dharma
toastTitle: Got Ladder from 22 to 60

quote.name: Krodha is the enemy of the mind. It clouds our judgment and leads us to do foolish things.
Krodha is the source of all suffering. It leads to hatred, violence, and destruction.
Ishvarbhakti is the highest form of dharma. It is the act of loving and serving God with all our heart and soul.
Ishvarbhakti is the path to enlightenment. It is the way to achieve union with God.

toast: You have landed in Sukhaloka as a result of viveka
toastTitle: Got Ladder from 46 to 62

quote.name: Justice shall be based on impartiality. Impartiality is the absence of partiality and hatred. He who is free from partiality should be appointed as judge.
Tapas, or penance, is the purification of the mind and body. It is the practice of self-discipline and self-control.
The destruction of penance is caused by desire, anger, greed, and delusion. It is also caused by attachment to the fruits of action.
Durvasana is a reminder that even the wisest and most powerful people can be overcome by their emotions.
Durvasana is an ember of anger, which can burn everything.
Kritajnata is the recognition of the good deeds done by others. It is the feeling of gratitude and appreciation for the help and support that we have received.
Kritajnata is the path to moksha. It is the way to achieve liberation from the cycle of birth and death.

toast: You have landed in ānanda loka as a result of gyāna
toastTitle: Got Ladder from 37 to 66

quote.name: Swakartavyalopana is the act of praising oneself. It is a form of arrogance and conceit.
Swakartavyalopana is the enemy of wisdom. It prevents us from learning from our mistakes.

toast: You have landed in rudra loka as a result of suvidyā
toastTitle: Got Ladder from 45 to 67

quote.name: Vairagyadhaarana is the practice of detachment. It is the letting go of attachment to the material world.
Vairagyadhaarana is the path to enlightenment. It is the way to achieve union with the divine.

toast: You have landed in vaikuṇṭha as a result of bhakti
toastTitle: Got Ladder from 54 to 68

quote.name: Bratbhanga is the breaking of a vow. It is a serious offense that can lead to bad karma.
Bratbhanga is the enemy of peace of mind. It prevents us from living a life of virtue.

toast: You have landed in brahma loka as a result of dāya
toastTitle: Got Ladder from 17 to 69

quote.name: Kshama is the greatest of all virtues. It is the ability to forgive those who have wronged us.
Kshama is the path to peace of mind. It is the way to achieve inner tranquility.
One who is an atheist does not have peace.
Poverty is the greatest suffering for a man.
Adhairya is the inability to bear pain or hardship. It is the opposite of patience.
Adhairya is the enemy of wisdom. It prevents us from learning from our mistakes.
Satkirti is the foundation of all happiness. It is the key to success in life.
Satkirti is like a shadow that follows us wherever we go. It is a reflection of our character and our actions.
Hinsa is the root of all evil. It is the cause of suffering and unhappiness.
Hinsa is the enemy of peace. It is the obstacle to happiness.
Atma nairmalya is the foundation of all happiness. It is the key to spiritual progress.
Atma nairmalya is like a clear mirror. It reflects the truth of who we are.
Sanyas ashrama is the stage of renunciation. It is the time to give up worldly attachments and focus on spiritual liberation.
Sanyas ashrama is the time to seek the truth. It is the time to find our true selves.
Ishvaropasana is the path to liberation. It is the way to unite with the divine.
Ishvaropasana is the way to peace of mind. It is the way to find inner tranquility.
Moha is the root of all suffering. It is the cause of delusion and ignorance.
Moha is like a veil that clouds our vision. It prevents us from seeing the truth.
Ajnananivritti is the goal of yoga. It is the state of perfect knowledge.
Ajnananivritti is like a light that dispels the darkness of ignorance. It allows us to see the truth.
Kama-vasana is the desire for pleasure. It is the root of all human motivation.
Kama-vasana is like a fire. It can be used to cook food or to burn down a house.
lolupta is the desire for more. It is the root of all greed and attachment.
lolupata is like a fire. It can consume everything in its path.
dushtavasis the company of the wicked. It is the path to ruin.
dushtavas is like a poison. It can slowly kill us from within.
Papanivritti is the turning away from sin. It is the path to liberation.
Papanivritti is like a boat that carries us across the river of samsara.

The Plane of the Neutral is where the player realises and experiences the sushumna through yogic practices. The sushumna flows through the spine. The idā and the pingalā nāḍī entwine around the sushmna as they meet in the region of the third eye.
Samadhi is the state of perfect concentration. It is the union of the individual consciousness with the universal consciousness.
Samadhi is like a river that flows through the mountains. It is the source of all peace and tranquility.
devanindais a sin that leads to great suffering. It is the root of all evil.
devaninda is like a poison. It can slowly kill us from within.
Daya is the highest form of love. It is the foundation of all morality.
Daya is like a river that flows through the desert. It brings relief and nourishment to all who are in need.
Svechachār is the ability to control one's own thoughts, words, and actions. It is the foundation of all virtue.
Svechachār is like a strong wall that protects us from harm. It keeps us safe from temptation and from making bad choices.
Droha is the worst of all sins. It destroys trust and relationships.
Droha is like a cancer that eats away at the heart.
Ahankar is the root of all suffering. It is the cause of delusion and ignorance.
Ahankar is like a veil that clouds our vision. It prevents us from seeing the truth.
Avikalta pascharya is the ability to stay focused on one's goal, even in the face of difficulty. It is the foundation of all success.
Avikaltapascharya is like a rock that withstands the storm. It is not shaken by the waves of change.
Vishayanuraga is the ability to let go of attachment to material things. It is the foundation of all spiritual practice.
Vishayanuraga is like a fire that burns away all attachments. It leads to liberation.
Adhipatya is the supreme power. It is the power to rule and command.
Adhipatya is like a fire. It can be used to cook food or to burn down a house.
Parama hansagati is the state of perfect detachment. It is the state of being free from all attachments, both material and spiritual.
Parama hansagati is like a swan that flies above the water. It is not affected by the waves or the currents.
Ananda is the supreme state of being. It is the state of being at peace and at one with the universe.
Ananda is like a river that flows through the universe. It is the source of all happiness and joy.
kusanga is like a disease. It can slowly corrupt us and lead us to ruin.
kusanga is like a fire. It can consume us if we are not careful.
ishwarasansargais the highest form of association. It is the association with the divine.
ishwarasansargais like a light that dispels the darkness of ignorance.
lobha is the root of all evil. It is the cause of suffering and unhappiness.
lobha is like a fire that consumes everything in its path.
Deshabhakti is the highest form of devotion. It is the devotion to one's motherland.
Deshabhakti is like a river that flows through the land. It nourishes and sustains all who live there.
Yajnabhimana is the pride that comes from sacrificing for others. It is the highest form of selflessness.
Yajnabhimana is like a flame that burns away all impurities. It leads to moksha.
Utkrishta jana are those who are noble in thought, word, and deed. They are the ones who make the world a better place.
Utkrishta jana are like the sun that shines on everyone, regardless of their caste, creed, or religion. They are the ones who bring light and hope to the world.
Vidyabhimana is the pride that comes from knowledge. It is the highest form of self-respect.
Vidyabhimana is like a lamp that illuminates the darkness of ignorance. It leads to wisdom and enlightenment.
Svarup darshana is the realization of one's true self. It is the highest goal of human life.
Svarup darshana is like the sun that shines through the clouds. It dispels the darkness of ignorance and reveals the truth.
Kailasha is the abode of Shiva. It is the mountain of the gods.
Swarga is like a lotus flower. It blooms in the heart of those who are pure and virtuous.
Swarga is the realm of the gods. It is a place of eternal happiness and bliss.
Vaikuntha is the abode of Vishnu. It is a place of eternal bliss and love.
Vaikuntha is like a lotus flower. It blooms in the heart of those who are devoted to Vishnu.
Moksha, nirvana, and avinashpada are all terms that refer to the same thing: liberation from the cycle of birth and death.
Moksha, nirvana, and avinashpada are like the sun. They shine in the hearts of those who are free from attachment and desire.

name: 99kapher
en: Click here to vist the SHOP page
hi: दुकान पर जाने के लिए यहां क्लिक करें
or: ଦୋକାନ ପୃଷ୍ଠାକୁ ଦେଖିବା ପାଇଁ ଏଠାରେ କ୍ଲିକ୍ କରନ୍ତୁ |
bn: দোকান পৃষ্ঠা দেখতে এখানে ক্লিক করুন
gu: દુકાન પૃષ્ઠની મુલાકાત લેવા માટે અહીં ક્લિક કરો
kn: ಅಂಗಡಿ ಪುಟವನ್ನು ಭೇಟಿ ಮಾಡಲು ಇಲ್ಲಿ ಕ್ಲಿಕ್ ಮಾಡಿ
ta: ஷாப் பக்கத்தைப் பார்க்க இங்கே கிளிக் செய்யவும்
te: షాప్ పేజీని సందర్శించడానికి ఇక్కడ క్లిక్ చేయండి
hu: Kattintson ide az üzlet oldalának megtekintéséhez
